alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Marion (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 1:06AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Caddo Parish, southeastern Marion and northeastern Harrison Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 106 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Vivian, or 24 miles southeast of Atlanta, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vivian, Oil City, Mooringsport, Hosston, Gilliam, Karnack, Gray, Uncertain and Caddo Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
